problem:
The matrices
\[\mathbf{A} = \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} 1 & x \\ y & -\frac{9}{5} \end{pmatrix} \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1} \quad \text{and} \quad \mathbf{B} = \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} \frac{12}{5} & \frac{1}{10} \\ 5 & z \end{pmatrix} \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1}\]satisfy $\mathbf{A} + \mathbf{B} = \mathbf{A} \mathbf{B}.$  Find $x + y + z.$
solution:
We have that
\[\mathbf{A} + \mathbf{B} = \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} \frac{17}{5} & x + \frac{1}{10} \\ y + 5 & z - \frac{9}{5} \end{pmatrix} \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1}\]and
\[\mathbf{A} \mathbf{B} =
\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} 1 & x \\ y & -\frac{9}{5} \end{pmatrix} \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1}
\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} \frac{12}{5} & \frac{1}{10} \\ 5 & z \end{pmatrix} \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1}
=
\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} 5x + \frac{12}{5} & xz + \frac{1}{10} \\ \frac{12}{5} y - 9 & \frac{1}{10} y - \frac{9}{5} z \end{pmatrix} \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1}
.\]Thus,
\begin{align*}
5x + \frac{12}{5} &= \frac{17}{5}, \\
xz + \frac{1}{10} &= x + \frac{1}{10}, \\
\frac{12}{5} y - 9 &= y + 5, \\
\frac{1}{10} y - \frac{9}{5} z &= z - \frac{9}{5}.
\end{align*}From the first equation, $x = \frac{1}{5},$ and from the third equation, $y = 10.$  Then from either the second equation or fourth equation, $z = 1.$  Hence, $x + y + z = \frac{1}{5} + 10 + 1 = \boxed{\frac{56}{5}}.$
steps:
## Step 1: Write down the equation given by the problem
\[\mathbf{A} + \mathbf{B} = \mathbf{A} \mathbf{B}\]where $\mathbf{A} = \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} 1 & x \\ y & -\frac{9}{5} \end{pmatrix}$ and $\mathbf{B} = \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} \frac{12}{5} & \frac{1}{10} \\ 5 & z \end{pmatrix}$.

## Step 2: Perform matrix addition on the left-hand side
\[\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} 1 & x \\ y & -\frac{9}{5} \end{pmatrix} + \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} \frac{12}{5} & \frac{1}{10} \\ 5 & z \end{pmatrix} = \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{

## Step 3: Perform matrix multiplication on the right-hand side
\[\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} 1 & x \\ y & -\frac{9}{5} \end{pmatrix} \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} \frac{12}{5} & \frac{1}{10} \\ 5 & z \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{12}{5} + 5x & \frac{1}{10} + xz \\ \frac{12}{5}y -\frac{9}{5} \cdot 5 & \frac{1}{10}y + z \left(-\frac{9}{5}\right) \end{pmatrix}\]

## Step 4: Equate the corresponding entries of the two matrices
\begin{align*}
1 + \frac{12}{5} &= \frac{12}{5} + 5x,\\
x &= \frac{1}{10} + xz,\\
y + 5 &= \frac{12}{5}y - 9,\\
-\frac{9}{5} + z &= \frac{1}{10}y - \frac{9}{5}z,
\end{align*}

## Step 8
\begin{align*}
-\frac{9}{5} + z &= \frac{1}{10}y - \frac{9}{5}z\\
\Rightarrow \qquad -\frac{9}{5} + \frac{9}{10} &= \frac{1}{10}(10) - \frac{9}{5}z\\
\Rightarrow \qquad -\frac{18}{10} + \frac{9}{10} &= 1 - \frac{9}{5}z\\
\Rightarrow \qquad -\frac{9}{10} &= 1 - \frac{9}{5}z\\
\Rightarrow \qquad \frac{9}{5}z &= 1 + \frac{9}{10}\\
\Rightarrow \qquad \frac{9}{5}z &= \frac{19}{10}\\
\Rightarrow \qquad z &= \frac{19}{10} \cdot \frac{5}{9}\\
\Rightarrow \qquad z &= \frac{19}{18}
\end{align*}
However, we know from step 6 that z = \frac{9

## Step 1: Write down the equation given by the problem
\[\mathbf{A} + \mathbf{B} = \mathbf{A} \mathbf{B}\]where $\mathbf{A} = \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} 1 & x \\ y & -\frac{9}{5} \end{pmatrix}$ and $\mathbf{B} = \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} \frac{12}{5} & \frac{1}{10} \\ 5 & z \end{pmatrix}$.

## Step 2: Perform matrix addition on the left-hand side
\[\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} 1 & x \\ y & -\frac{9}{5} \end{pmatrix} + \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} \frac{12}{5} & \frac{1}{10} \\ 5 & z \end{pmatrix} = \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{

## Step 3: Perform matrix multiplication on the right-hand side
\[\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} 1 & x \\ y & -\frac{9}{5} \end{pmatrix} \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5} \begin{pmatrix} \frac{12}{5} & \frac{1}{10} \\ 5 & z \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{12}{5} + 5x & \frac{1}{10} + xz \\ \frac{12}{5}y -\frac{9}{5} \cdot 5 & \frac{1}{10}y + z \left(-\frac{9}{5}\right) \end{pmatrix}\]

## Step 4: Equate the corresponding entries of the two matrices
\begin{align*}
1 + \frac{12}{5} &= \frac{12}{5} + 5x,\\
x &= \frac{1}{10} + xz,\\
y + 5 &= \frac{12}{5}y - 9,\\
-\frac{9}{5} + z &= \frac{1}{10}y - \frac{9}{5}z,
\end{align*}

## Step 8
\begin{align*}
-\frac{9}{5} + z &= \frac{1}{10}y - \frac{9}{5}z\\
\Rightarrow \qquad -\frac{9}{5} + \frac{9}{10} &= \frac{1}{10}(10) - \frac{9}{5}z\\
\Rightarrow \qquad -\frac{18}{10} + \frac{9}{10} &= 1 - \frac{9}{5}z\\
\Rightarrow \qquad -\frac{9}{10} &= 1 - \frac{9}{5}z\\
\Rightarrow \qquad \frac{9}{5}z &= 1 + \frac{9}{10}\\
\Rightarrow \qquad \frac{9}{5}z &= \frac{19}{10}\\
\Rightarrow \qquad z &= \frac{19}{10} \cdot \frac{5}{9}\\
\Rightarrow \qquad z &= \frac{19}{18}
\end{align*}
